name: krig 3d geology
desc: Estimate the geologic surface information from ....

properties.name: Switch Property View
properties.desc: Edit the renderable (red) port properties for the module.

properties.name: Grid Type
properties.desc: The Grid Type defines the nature of the domain that will be kriged. The Rectilinear option is used when the user wishes to produce a model that contains estimated values everywhere inside a user specified rectangular domain. The Convex Hull Option is used when the user wishes to produce a model that can have an irregular boundary that is defined by the distribution of measured data points. The Convex Hull of a data set can be thought of as the domain that would be outlined by stretching a rubber band around the external data points in the data set.  The Finite Difference domain allows the user to krige the elevations of the geologic layers directly to the finite difference grid node locations set using the finite difference controls.

properties.name: Only Create Grid
properties.desc: The Only Create Grid toggle forces the module to exit after the gridding is complete with no interpolation done.

properties.name: Grid Origin
properties.desc: The Grid Origins allow the user to set the minimum coordinate domain in which kriging of the geologic surfaces will be completed.

properties.name: Grid Maximum Extents
properties.desc: The Grid Maximum Extents allow the user to set the maximum coordinate domain in which kriging of the geologic surfaces will be completed. This control is disabled for Finite Difference Gridding.

properties.name: X Resolution
properties.desc: The X Resolution specifies the number of grid nodes that will be included within the model's X domain. The number of grid elements along the X axis of the model is simply the X Resolution minus one, as every element has two bounding nodes.

properties.name: Y Resolution
properties.desc: The Y Resolution specifies the number of grid nodes that will be included within the model's Y domain. The number of grid elements along the Y axis of the model is simply the Y Resolution minus one, as every element has two bounding nodes.

properties.name: Boundary Offset
properties.desc: The Boundary Offset parameter sets the distance that the convex hull for the kriging domain will be set outside of the actual convex hull of the data. This parameter allows the user to specify the distance outside of the actual data in which the parameter values will be extrapolated.

properties.name: Grid Rotation
properties.desc: The Grid Rotation is for rotating a finite difference grid around the Min X, Min Y point.

properties.name: Finite Difference Grid
properties.desc: This window allows the creation of a model broken into regions. There is no limit to the number of regions and each region can have any number cells and can have cells sizes that vary. The user builds the finite difference model grid by specifying the distance between the first and second grid nodes (or the element width) in the Initial Cell Size input field. The number of cells in this region is then specified in the Cells To Add input field. If a gradually varying cell size is desired, then a multiplication factor is specified in the Cell Size Change input field. Values greater than 1.0 create an increasing element size, and values less than 1.0 create diminishing element sizes.

properties.name: Display Grid
properties.desc: The Display Grid control allows the user to display the grid in the red output port.

properties.name: Grid Vertical Scale
properties.desc: The Grid Vertical Scale is the Z exaggeration of the output display grid, this does not affect the elevation data on the grid.

properties.name: Reach
properties.desc: The Reach input field defines the radial distance (in user units) from any given model node that the kriging module will look for data points to be included in the estimation of the model parameter at that node. Setting the reach to 0 will result in the module calculating a reach value which is approximately two-thirds of the longest distance between any two data points in the data set.

properties.name: Points In Reach
properties.desc: The Points In Reach parameter defines the maximum number of data points (within the specified reach) that will be considered for the parameter estimation at a model node.

properties.name: Quadrant Search
properties.desc: Quadrant Search changes the method by which data sample points are selected for inclusion in the kriging matrix. If this is on searching is performed for each of the four quadrants surrounding the point to be kriged.

properties.name: Use All Data
properties.desc: The Use All Data parameter will cause all of the data points to be used when kriging not just those within the reach.  This provides the smoothest surfaces, and can even be faster in some cases.

properties.name: Max Points For Use All Data
properties.display: Max Points For Use All Data
properties.desc: The Max Points For Use All Data provides a cap for large models.  If the number of points in the file is greater than this cap then reach/points method of kriging will be used.

properties.name: Estimate In Thickness Space
properties.desc: The Estimate In Thickness Space option is used for .geo files.  When the option is on, surfaces can not rise above the surfaces above them unless the are flagged as pinched values.  With it off, pinch flags are ignored and each surface will be kriged independently of the other surfaces.

properties.name: Bottom In Thickness Space
properties.desc: The Bottom in Thickness Space toggle will cause the last horizon to be treated in thickness space as well as the middle horizons.

properties.name: Pinch Factor
properties.desc: The Pinch Factor parameter provides the ability to control where pinching occurs between positive thicknesses and borings having the pinch flag.  It defaults to 1.0 which causes pinching to occur approximately half-way between positive thicknesses and borings having the pinch flag.

properties.name: Points In Pinch
properties.desc: The Points In Pinch parameter determines how many of the nearest points will be used to determine the estimated thickness at the pinch flag location.

properties.name: Use Gradients
properties.desc: The Use Gradients option is used Natural Neighbor interpolation.  When the option is on, gradients estimated at the sample points improve the interpolation result.

properties.name: Estimation Method
properties.desc: Each method has its pros and cons and should be researched before being changed.

properties.name: Computational Surface Type
properties.desc: A Computational Surface should be created after the initial gridding is complete.  Then the suface type should be selected.

properties.name: Include Surface
properties.desc: The Include Surface parameter allows a user selected surface from the file to be included in the output.

properties.name: Include Surface Number
properties.desc: If Include Surface is selected then the user can set which surface number to include.

properties.name: Surface Position
properties.desc: If Include Surface is selected and the suface number is set then the user should decide whether that suface is above or below the computational surface.

properties.name: Heading Dip Value
properties.desc: The Heading and Dip values are used to align the Computational Surface.

properties.name: Elevation
properties.desc: The Elevation to translate the heading-dip plane by.

properties.name: Anchor Point
properties.desc: The Anchor Point values to translate the heading-dip plane by by.

properties.name: Material ID
properties.desc: The Material ID for the generated surface.

properties.name: Surface Name
properties.desc: The Surface Name for the generated surface.

properties.name: Elevation Surfaces
properties.desc: The computational surfaces created by this method are based upon set elevations.

properties.name: Depth From
properties.desc: The method for determining the starting elevation to make each depth from.

properties.name: Surface Number
properties.desc: The surface number to compute depths from.

properties.name: Depth Layers
properties.desc: The computational layers created by this method are based upon the depth from the selected surface.

properties.name: Display Variogram Ellipse
properties.desc: The Display Variogram Ellipsoid control allows the user to display the variography ellipse.

properties.name: Resolution
properties.desc: The resolution to use for the ellipse. Larger numbers create more detailed representations.

properties.name: Ellipse Scale
properties.desc: The Ellipse Scale will scale the ellipse equally along each axis.

properties.name: X Offset
properties.desc: The X Offset slider will allow the user to translate the ellipse along the x axis

properties.name: Y Offset
properties.desc: The Y Offset slider will allow the user to translate the ellipse along the y axis

properties.name: Z Offset
properties.desc: The Z Offset slider will allow the user to translate the ellipse along the z axis

properties.name: Ellipsoid Color
properties.desc: The ellipse is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Display Variogram Lines
properties.desc: The Display Variogram Lines allow the user to display lines aligned with the variography ellipse.

properties.name: Line Scale
properties.desc: The Line Scale is a scalar that sets the lenght of the variogram lines relative the scale of the ellipse.

properties.name: Primary Ratio Color
properties.desc: The primary ratio axis is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Secondary Ratio Color
properties.desc: The secondary ratio axis is a solid color which can be selected using this control.

properties.name: Display Variogram Ellipse
